MarshalledOrderNote.NoteTxt: The Amendments have been arranged in accordance with the Resolution of the Programming Sub-Committee.

Resolution.ResolutionDate: The Programming Sub-Committee appointed by the Speaker in respect of the Bill agreed the following Resolution at its meeting on Tuesday 19 May (Standing Order No. 83C):

ResolutionPara.ResolutionPara_text: the Committee shall (in addition to its first meeting at 10.30 a.m. on Tuesday 2 June) meet—

ResolutionSubPara.ResolutionSubPara_text: at 10.30 a.m. and 4.00 p.m. on Tuesday 9 June;
at 9.00 a.m. and 1.00 p.m. on Thursday 11 June;
at 10.30 a.m. and 4.00 p.m. on Tuesday 16 June;
at 9.00 a.m. and 1.00 p.m. on Thursday 18 June;
at 10.30 a.m. and 4.00 p.m. on Tuesday 23 June;
at 9.00 a.m. and 1.00 p.m. on Thursday 25 June;
at 10.30 a.m. and 4.00 p.m. on Tuesday 30 June;
at 9.00 a.m. and 1.00 p.m. on Thursday 2 July;
at 10.30 a.m. and 4.00 p.m. on Tuesday 7 July;

ResolutionPara.ResolutionPara_text: the Committee shall hear oral evidence in accordance with the following Table—

Row.Cell: Equality and Diversity Forum/nEquality and Human Rights Commission/nEmployment Tribunals Service
Help the Aged and Age Concern/nChildren’s Rights Alliance/nDisability Charities Consortium/nRADAR/nCarers UK
Stonewall/nGender Identity Research and Education Society/nRunnymede Trust/nRace on the Agenda
Fawcett Society/nWomen’s National Commission/nWomen Like Us
British Humanist Association/nGeneral Synod of the Church of England/nCatholic Bishops Conference/nSufi Muslim Council
Confederation of British Industry/nAssociation of British Insurers/nFederation of Small Businesses/nChartered Institute of Personnel and Development/nTrades Union Congress

ResolutionPara.ResolutionPara_text: the proceedings on consideration of the Bill in Committee shall be taken in the following order: Clauses 1 to 6; Schedule 1; Clauses 7 to 29; Schedules 2 and 3; Clauses 30 to 35; Schedules 4 and 5; Clauses 36 to 49; Schedule 6; Clauses 50 to 75; Schedule 7; Clauses 76 to 78; Schedules 8 and 9; Clauses 79 to 83; Schedule 10; Clause 84; Schedule 11; Clauses 85 to 89; Schedule 12; Clauses 90 to 93; Schedule 13; Clause 94; Schedule 14; Clauses 95 to 101; Schedules 15 and 16; Clauses 102 to 110; Schedule 17; Clauses 111 to 143; Schedule 18; Clause 144; Schedule 19; Clauses 145 to 179; Schedule 20; Clauses 180 to 182; Schedule 21; Clauses 183 and 184; Schedule 22; Clauses 185 to 189; Schedule 23; Clauses 190 and 191; Schedule 24; Clauses 192 and 193; Schedule 25; Clauses 194 to 198; Schedules 26 and 27; Clauses 199 to 201; Schedule 28; Clauses 202 to 205; new Clauses; new Schedules; remaining proceedings on the Bill;
the proceedings shall (so far as not previously concluded) be brought to a conclusion at 7.00 p.m. on Tuesday 7 July.

Motion.Text.motion: The Solicitor General has given notice of her intention to move a motion in the terms of the Resolution of the Programming Sub-Committee [Standing Order No. 83C(9)].

Text.motion.Bold: The Programming Sub-Committee is expected to agree a revised Resolution at its meeting on Tuesday 2 June.

Motion.Proposer.name: The Solicitor General
Motion.Text.motion: That, subject to the discretion of the Chairman, any written evidence received by the Committee shall be reported to the House for publication.

Motion.Proposer.name: The Solicitor General
Motion.Text.motion: That, at this and any subsequent meeting at which oral evidence is to be heard, the Committee shall sit in private until the witnesses are admitted.

Amendment.Text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Clause 1, page 1, line 26, leave out subsections (2) to (7).
Clause 1, page 1, line 29, leave out subsection (3) and insert—

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: A Minister of the Crown may by regulations list public authorities to which this section applies.’.

Amendment.Text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Clause 1, page 2, line 18, leave out subsection (4).
Page 1, line 21, leave out Clause 1.
Page 2, line 39, leave out Clause 2.
Page 3, line 37, leave out Clause 3.
Clause 4, page 4, line 11, at end insert ‘or paternity’.
Clause 13, page 9, line 5, leave out ‘because of’ and insert ‘on grounds of’.
Clause 14, page 10, line 5, leave out paragraph (c).
Clause 18, page 13, leave out line 17.
Clause 26, page 19, line 3, leave out paragraph (a).
Clause 30, page 22, line 6, leave out paragraph (a).
Clause 73, page 55, line 14, leave out ‘by regulations’ and insert ‘not’.
Clause 73, page 55, line 17, at end insert ‘and

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: employees who have a disability and employees who do not have a disability.’.

Amendment.Text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Clause 73, page 55, line 19, at end insert—

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: the Security Service, the Secret Intelligence Service or the Government Communications Headquarters;’.

Amendment.Text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Clause 73, page 55, line 20, leave out paragraph (b).
Page 55, line 13, leave out Clause 73.
Clause 118, page 85, line 28, leave out paragraph (c).
Clause 118, page 85, line 29, leave out subsection (3) and insert—

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: In the event that an employment tribunal finds that an employer has contravened a term modified or included by an equality clause, the employer shall be required to undertake an audit, to be known as an equal pay audit, and to make the results of the audit available in a manner prescribed in regulations made by the Secretary of State.’.

Amendment.Text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Clause 118, page 86, line 8, leave out subsection (7).
Clause 143, page 105, line 14, at beginning insert ‘Subsection (1) will also apply to’.
Clause 143, page 105, leave out lines 15 and 16 and insert ‘except in relation to matters of employment’.
Clause 143, page 105, line 35, at end insert—

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: A public authority must collect and publish data annually showing, in the exercise of its functions, the extent to which it has succeeded in meeting the requirements under subsection (1).’.

Amendment.Text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Clause 147, page 108, line 27, at end insert—

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: Before regulations are made under this section, there must be laid before both Houses of Parliament—

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: evidence that the regulations will enable the better performance by public authorities of the duty imposed by subsection (1).’.

Amendment.Text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Clause 153, page 113, line 2, leave out ‘reasonably thinks’ and insert ‘can demonstrate’.
Clause 153, page 113, line 16, leave out ‘as qualified as’ and insert ‘equally qualified to’.
Page 113, line 1, leave out Clause 153.
Clause 190, page 135, line 23, at end insert—

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: An order under subsection (1) may only be made if the Minister can demonstrate that persons of a specified age are being discriminated against for no legitimate reason.’.

Amendment.Text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Page 135, line 9, leave out Clause 190.
Clause 191, page 136, line 4, leave out ‘thinks’ and insert ‘can demonstrate’.
Clause 191, page 136, line 9, leave out ‘thinks’ and insert ‘can demonstrate’.
Clause 191, page 136, line 16, leave out ‘thinks’ and insert ‘can demonstrate’.
Clause 191, page 136, line 23, leave out ‘thinks’ and insert ‘can demonstrate’.
Page 136, line 1, leave out Clause 191.

SubSection1_PgfTag.SubSection_text: The Dean Forest (Mines) Act 1838 is amended as follows.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: In section XIV (Who shall be deemed Free Miners), line 1, leave out “male”.
In section XV (Quarrymen to be deemed Free Miners for certain purposes), line 1, leave out “male”.’.

New_C_STitle_PgfTag.ClauseTitle_text: Mental Health Act 1983: Members of Parliament

SubSection1_PgfTag.SubSection_text: The Mental Health Act 1983 is amended as follows.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: Subsections (2) to (7) of section 141 of the Mental Health Act 1983 are deleted.’.

Order.House.OrderPreamble: That the following provisions shall apply to the Equality Bill:

OrderPara.OrderPara_text: The Bill shall be committed to a Public Bill Committee.
Proceedings in the Public Bill Committee shall (so far as not previously concluded) be brought to a conclusion on 7 July 2009.
The Public Bill Committee shall have leave to sit twice on the first day on which it meets.
Proceedings on consideration shall (so far as not previously concluded) be brought to a conclusion one hour before the moment of interruption on the day on which those proceedings are commenced.
Proceedings on Third Reading shall (so far as not previously concluded) be brought to a conclusion at the moment of interruption on that day.
Standing Order No. 83B (Programming committees) shall not apply to proceedings on consideration and Third Reading.
Any other proceedings on the Bill (including any proceedings on consideration of Lords Amendments or on any further messages from the Lords) may be programmed.
